meanings.definition: To form or arrange in the manner of a ladder.
meanings.sent1: She laddered the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He laddered the blocks to reach the top.
meanings.sent3: The ants laddered up the tree to get to the juicy fruit.
meanings.sent4: The vines laddered their way up the old brick wall.
meanings.sent5: The students laddered their desks for the group activity.

meanings.definition: To develop a series of runs or holes in a stocking or other garment.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally laddered her tights while rushing to get ready.
meanings.sent2: The puppy laddered the curtains while trying to peek outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten laddered the owner's favorite sweater.
meanings.sent4: The thorns laddered the delicate fabric of her dress.
meanings.sent5: The sharp nail laddered the sleeve of his shirt.
